definitions.definition: a comprehensive description and explanation of an idea or theory.
examples: the exposition and defense of his ethics

definitions.definition: the part of a movement, especially in sonata form, in which the principal themes are first presented.
the part of a play or work of fiction in which the background to the main conflict is introduced.
a large public exhibition of art or trade goods.
examples: exhibition, fair, trade fair, trade show, show, expo, display, presentation, demonstration, exhibit the exposition will feature 200 exhibits

definitions.definition: the action of making public; exposure.
examples: the country squires dreaded the exposition of their rustic conversation
